questions.question: What was the first successful English settlement in the New World?

choices.answer: Roanoke
Plymouth
New York
Jamestown

questions.question: Which is NOT a reason colonists came to America

choices.answer: More Farmland
Religious Freedom
Fed up with European Wars
Forced to leave Europe

questions.question: What did Natives teach the colonists?

choices.answer: How to grow crops
How to survive the harsh winter
Native religion
Native language

questions.question: What is one theory about how early peoples migrated from Asia to the Americas?

choices.answer: They rode on mammoths and caribou
They came with Columbus
They came on horseback
They walked across a land bridge

questions.question: What is one theory about why early peoples migrated from Asia to the Americas?

choices.answer: Hunters followed animals
Horses were plentiful
Land was free
No diseases existed

questions.question: What was the effect of agriculture on the way of life of the early peoples?

choices.answer: They settled in one place
They didn’t hunt anymore
They started to go to school
They sold more food

questions.question: Which animal was important to the Plains people for meat, clothing, blankets, and utensils?

choices.answer: mammoth
caribou
deer
buffalo

questions.question: Why did Columbus sail west on his first expedition?

choices.answer: to find a shorter route to the Indies
to show King Ferdinand he could make the journey
to take part in the Columbian Exchange
to discover the Bahama Islands

questions.question: Term? US believed it was their God-given right to own land from the Atlantic to the Pacific

choices.answer: Providence
imperialism
interstate commerce
Manifest Destiny

questions.question: How did Southern states often restrict African American voting rights after the 15th Amendment?

choices.answer: by using state militias
by using federal and supreme court rulings
by cancelling federal elections
by enforcing poll taxes, literacy tests, grandfather clauses

questions.question: Congress has the power to collect taxes, coin, money, control the postal service, and ________?

choices.answer: Declare War
Appoint Cabinet Members
Grant Pardons
Appoint Federal Judges

questions.question: Differences between North and South: Which of the following does NOT describe the North?

choices.answer: Short growing season
economy based on agriculture
Water Power used for factories
huge population due to immigration

questions.question: Differences between the North and South: Which is of the following does NOT describe the South?

choices.answer: Climate ideal for agriculture
Plantations owned by wealthy few
very few cities
economy based on manufacturing

questions.question: What issue was resolved by the Great Compromise during the Constitutional convention?

choices.answer: a Bill of Rights
Territorial expansion
the slave trade
Congressional representation

questions.question: How did the cotton gin affect the South?

choices.answer: it led to the decline of slavery
it led to a decrease in factory jobs
it made cotton farming more profitable
it made cotton clothing more expensive

questions.question: Which issue discussed at the constitutional convention eventually led to the Great Compromise?

choices.answer: the creation of a common currency
the creation of the Electoral college
the legality of slavery in the states
the means of representation in congress

questions.question: Changes in the US population between 1800 and 1900 were mostly the result of

choices.answer: increased industrialization and urbanization
the abolition of slavery
the extension of voting and property rights
higher birth rates

questions.question: Why did Congress pass the Indian Removal Act of 1830?

choices.answer: to make land available for miners and farmers
to organize territory west of the Mississippi River
to provide river access to factory owners to power mills
protect American Indians from settlers encroaching on land

questions.question: Which issue most led to the Constitutional Convention?

choices.answer: the process of becoming an American Citizen
managing disputes among the states
the role of the Vice President
creating government checks and balances

questions.question: Why was the decision in Marbury v. Madison significant?

choices.answer: it limited the use of the elastic clause of the Constitution
it formed regulation for interstate commerce
it formed the basis for the power of judicial review
it strengthened the contract clause of the Constitution

questions.question: What resulted from the Confederate attack and capture of Fort Sumter in 1861?

choices.answer: it decreased the support for the war in the North
it increased the support for secession in the south
encouraged European nations to aid the Confederacy
persuaded the Union to compromise with the Confederacy

questions.question: How did Susan B. Anthony influence the course of US History?

choices.answer: she inspired enslaved people to fight for freedom
she improved the working conditions in factories
she organized women to protest for equality
she promoted the building of public schools

questions.question: Which best describes the list? Declaration of Ind., Articles of Confederation, US Constitution

choices.answer: Colonization of North America
The American Revolution
Creation of a New Nation
The Prosperous Nation

questions.question: How did US Constitution resolve the issue of determining representation in legislative branch?

choices.answer: it created a Supreme Court
it created the Electoral College
it created a four year term for office of President
it created a two house Congress

questions.question: Which group suppressed political/economic rights of African Americans through violence?

choices.answer: Know Nothing Party
Ku Klux Klan
carpetbaggers
Copperheads

questions.question: What did President Washington believe about political parties?

choices.answer: They would lead to economic depression
They would lead to armed rebellion
They could lead to a weak central government
They could lead to an abuse of power over the people

questions.question: The Industrial Revolution is best defined as a

choices.answer: era of growth when machines became important to industry
era of excitement about approaches to controlling Nature
era of explosive encounters between workers & factory owners
era of turmoil/upheaval within the United States government

questions.question: What happened to workers in textile industry because of Lowell’s introduction of a new system?

choices.answer: workers were laid off because of improved processes
Investors were hesitant to support because of female labor
Males began to resent female workers
More women became mill workers because of new opportunity

questions.question: Which of these ideas did religious leader Charles Grandison Finney express?

choices.answer: Doing good deeds is not proof of faith.
Men are closer to God than women are.
Religious leaders alone can be free from sin.
Salvation is in the hands of the individual.

questions.question: The temperance movement was a

choices.answer: initiative to restrict use of alcohol to religious ceremony
bid to ban the manufacture of hard liquor and beer
study of the effects of daily alcohol consumption on males
effort to get people to use discipline to stop drinking

questions.question: Which contributions did Horace Mann make to the education reform movement in the 19th century?

choices.answer: developed new ways of instructing students with handicaps.
extended length of the school year and fought for equality
He fought for improvements to the education of women.
He was responsible for the integration of public schools.

questions.question: The Freedmen’s Bureau was a/an

choices.answer: organization to aid poor southerners/educate freed slaves.
group that established rules for freedmen in the U.S.
organization made up of a group of freed African Americans.
group designed to rebuild the economy of the South.

questions.question: What did ratification of the Thirteenth Amendment mean for African Americans?

choices.answer: African Americans had same opportunities as white Americans.
African Americans were compensated for labor during slavery.
It gave African American citizens the right to vote.
provided African Americans with a future free from slavery.

questions.question: Which group did the 14th Amendment exclude from U.S. citizenship?

choices.answer: antislavery supporters
Native Americans
African Americans
Confederacy supporters

questions.question: The Transportation Revolution was a period of

choices.answer: rebellion against foreign countries use of American shipping
economic depression brought on by inferior modes of travel
public disapproval of traditional modes of transit
rapid growth in the speed and convenience of travel

questions.question: What is a federal system of government designed to do?

choices.answer: give all authority to executive branch
limit role of central government to postal services
divide power between state and national governments
stretch reserved authority of states

questions.question: Use your knowledge of Social Studies to select 2 main purposes of the Bill of Rights

choices.answer: protect freedoms/limit power of central government
limit power of state government/ empower central government
outline rights of fed. government/strengthen economy
dictate how citizens engage government/how amendments pass

questions.question: The Seneca Falls Convention in 1848 was significant because it

choices.answer: forced government to discuss petition against slavery
marked the start of the women's right movement
granted women right to participate in voting
revealed need for temperance and education reform

questions.question: How did the US view its role in the Western Hemisphere under the Monroe Doctrine?

choices.answer: US wanted to prevent nations from becoming independent
US wanted to keep nations from becoming colonized
US wanted to prevent nations from fighting one another
US was going to take over other nations

questions.question: What impact did the Missouri Compromise of 1820 have on the United States?

choices.answer: temporarily reduced tension in Congress on issue of slavery
established route of transcontinental railroad
established US Indian Policy in western territories
slowed settlement and trade in western territories

questions.question: What factor most influenced large-scale westward migration in mid-1800's?

choices.answer: growth of textile industries
establishment of local business
expansion of the railroad system
development of the telegraph system

questions.question: Which statement best compares the US in 1800 to the US in 1898?

choices.answer: More immigrants in 1800 than in 1898
The US has more wealth in 1800 than in 1898
More overland transportation routes in 1800 than in 1898
The country was physically smaller in 1800 than in 1898

questions.question: How did interpretation of 10th Amendment contribute to tensions leading to Civil War?

choices.answer: it gave limited power to states
it created economic inequality among states
it allowed the states to create their own laws about slavery
it allowed people in the states to maintain their own armies

questions.question: Why do historians use a variety of sources when they are writing a research article?

choices.answer: to ensure that their conclusions are valid
to discover opinions identical to their own
to show their ability to use information resources
to show how knowledge changes with technology

questions.question: Which issue most led to the Constitutional Convention?

choices.answer: creating government checks and balances
managing disputes among the states
the role of the VP
the process of becoming an American citizen

questions.question: What issue is most likely to involve cooperation between governments of two or more countries?

choices.answer: public education
unemployment
health care
fair trade

questions.question: Which is the most characteristic of a Western Hemisphere nation-state?

choices.answer: command economies
open national borders
privately funded militaries
elected leaders

questions.question: Use your knowledge of Social Studies to select two main purposes of the Bill of Rights.

choices.answer: protect basic freedoms
maintain the need for a strong central government
protect Americans from international invasions
limit the power of the federal government

questions.question: Which characteristic do all entrepreneurs share when it comes to establishing a business?

choices.answer: They are willing to risk failure
They have large amounts of capital
They have many years of experience
They are willing to ignore laws

questions.question: Which characteristic do most countries with a market economy share?

choices.answer: the people take jobs appointed to them
the government controls the businesses
the people run and own businesses
the government provides citizens with money and land
